channel.title: NHC Eastern North Pacific
channel.description: Active tropical cyclones in the Eastern North Pacific

item.title: Eastern North Pacific Tropical Weather Outlook
item.description:
000
ABPZ20 KNHC 082326
TWOEP

Tropical Weather Outlook
NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL
500 PM PDT Tue Aug 8 2023

For the eastern North Pacific...east of 140 degrees west longitude:

Central East Pacific:
A tropical wave is producing widespread disorganized showers and
thunderstorms a couple of hundred miles south of the southern coast
of Mexico. Environmental conditions are expected to support gradual
development of the wave, and a tropical depression could form over
the weekend while the system moves generally westward across the
central portion of the basin.
* Formation chance through 48 hours...low...near 0 percent.
* Formation chance through 7 days...medium...60 percent.

$$
Forecaster D. Zelinsky
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: There are no tropical cyclones at this time.
item.description: No tropical cyclones as of Wed, 09 Aug 2023 02:40:04 GMT
